sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Cordifragium, or, The sacrifice of a broken heart, open'd, offer'd, own'd, and honour'd. Presented in a sermon at St Pauls London, November 25. 1660. By Francis Walsall D.D. chaplain to his Majesty, and prebendary of St. Peters Westminster. Walsall, Francis, d. 1661.
[8], 48 p.
printed by Abraham Miller, for John Sherley, at the Golden Pelican in little Brittain, London : 1661.
Running title reads: The sacrifice of a broken heart opened, offered, owned, and honoured. Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 6", "1660 Feb. 6"; 1 in imprint date crossed out and "0" written in. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[8], 48 p.
printed by Abraham Miller, for John Sherley, at the Golden Pelican in little Brittain, London : 1661.
Running title reads: The sacrifice of a broken heart opened, offered, owned, and honoured. Annotation on Thomason copy: "feb: 6", "1660 Feb. 6"; 1 in imprint date crossed out and "0" written in. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

the Golden Pelican in little Brittain
